quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello hello. Top of the morning to you!  Ooh ooh! Green M&Ms! Nature's Viagra! [Grabs and pours Kevin-esque scoop of M&Ms into his coat pocket] Two of my favorite joke areas combined. It'll be a good day.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't want to bring my friends, why can't it just be the two of us?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Because it's St. Patrick's Day, people go out in groups.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well why don't you invite your friends?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Why are you being so weird about this?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Stop fighting. Just on St Patrick's Day, okay? Just one perfect day a year. No hassles, no problems, no kids.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Why no kids?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, where are your kids?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Nope. Nuh -uh. Not today!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is St. Patrick's Day, and here in Scranton that is a huge deal. It is the closest that the Irish will ever get to Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Welcome back, "Dad!"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, thank you!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Welcome back Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey... [reveal Dwight's Mega-Desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Very good. Okay. Will get back to you right away on that, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What do we got here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mega-Desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Command central.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hm hm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Surveillance, gaming- and business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. [Pulls desks apart] Just gotta...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Come on! Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dweedle Dee and Dweedle Dumb-ass have been away on maternity leave. Now Dweedle Dumb-ass is back, and we have a problem. Yes, getting hooked on Mega-Desk was my own damn fault. But ... I don't care about assigning blame. All I care about is Mega-Desk. That is all I care about. Getting. More. Mega-Desk.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh, I love this, so much fun! There's such team spirit in this room! 'Morning Darling!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Morning!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well, this is my last day at the Scranton branch for a while. But I'm leaving it in the very capable hands of some of the loveliest people I've ever had the pleasure of knowing. Oh I'm gonna miss this place. And the snow! Hoo, my dogs love peeing in that snow! Makes me think they're onto something.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh good morning sweetheart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Morning, honey-pile.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: I'm sorry but is that a gift I see in your hands?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is. This is a little something for you to remember your time here in Scranton by.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: [pulls out glass cube with coal.] Is that a lump of coal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes it is!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Have I been that naughty?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no no- that is a good gift actually. Buildings here in Scranton are literally powered by coal.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Err, thank you very much. We, we don't get to see much coal in Tallahassee, I'm used to alligators, and some of the worst Chinese food you've ever tasted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm, that sounds great, actually.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well, if you ever get down in my neck of the woods, you got a place to stay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: When you work for Sabre, only one thing matters. And I don't care if you're a loser, or you practice bestiality, if Jo likes you, you are in. And I am in!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin go braugh!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy go braugh to you!  Nice kilt!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thanks. It's actually my sister's old field hockey skirt.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin and I have our first date tonight, and it has to be perfect. Why? Because according to "How I Met Your Mother" that's the date that your kids are going to wait patiently to hear about, and you better have a good story for them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. [re-enters bullpen from kitchen.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No-no-no-no-no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh come on. Come on. Five more minutes? Five more minutes of Mega-Desk? Please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [swats over various photos and knickknacks, points at paperwork] Is this yours or mine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They say that no man is an island. False! I am an island and this island is volcanic. And it is about to erupt. With the molten hot lava of strategy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good Lord! [Photo of Cece on Jim's desktop] I can't believe I'm missing this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's kind of like that lip thing she did last night, like a half snarl, half smile? I get the sense that she's very ironic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. Love you. We'll talk soon. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Must be amazing being a father right, a miracle of life?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It is. Big time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah, that baby is just discovering the whole wide world right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pretty amazing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What up is, what down is, who Mom is, who Dad is. Must be tough being here with all that going on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh it's tough being here for a lot of reasons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I mean, you're here at work, and the baby thinks that the refrigerator is its father.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is that what happened to you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll tell you what happened to me. I didn't see my father for the first two years of my life. I thought my mother was my father, and my wet-nurse was my mother.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's a common mistake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Turned out fine for me. But Mose? Oh. Same story, different ending.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hey! [Erin sneezing at desk] Are you sick?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, no I'm fine, I just have a little indigestion.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: In your nose?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes.  [Angela returns to desk and puts embroidered breathing mask on]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I'm a little sick but I don't want to miss my date with Andy. I'll get better. Whenever I'm sick it goes away within a few hours. Except once, when I was in the hospital from age three to six.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Now, after all the talking I've been doing. It's your turn. This is a town hall meeting. I want to hear what you all sound like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is a great idea JB.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Thank you. You know I get way too many ideas from the top. Now I want to hear your ideas. I mean, did you guys know that Liquid Paper? That wasn't invented by some fancy engineer. No, that was created by a lowly typist.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Jo, I have an idea, for suntan lotion - soap.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: You know it doesn't have to be an invention.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I have a question.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oscar, homosexual accountant.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: In the training manual it says, that there is a minority executive training program in Tallahassee?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: I am so proud of Sabre's "Print In All Colors" initiative. Any Sabre employee of color, is welcome to apply. [Kelly applauds]  Daryl?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Daryl. Mellow, soulful, smart for warehouse...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Okay hush now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: The Sabre shipping method could be more efficient. Combining inventory systems makes sense on paper, but printers and paper ship differently. It'll be faster to deliver them separately, instead of waiting on everything to come in.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: But you wouldn't need more trucks?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Not at all. There's a way that it can be scheduled. I sketched this out downstairs.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh look at you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look at that picture that you drew. Nice job! We're very proud of you. You know what, we're gonna tape that up on the refrigerator in the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: [Looks over his proposal] I like this Daryl. I like this a lot. Maybe you should be doing your sketching upstairs. Would you like an office up here?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yeah. Take Jim's old office.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Um. I set my stuff up in there. So...  just give me a few minutes to clean that out for you.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yeah, I want to hear more from you.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Okay. Any questions? Anything on anybody's mind? I'm leaving tonight, this is your last chance for a while!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh no! Say it's not so, Jo, we're gonna miss you, we're gonna miss you so much!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yes, well okay. Florida ain't that far away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I am heading down there.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well, anytime now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How about July 4th weekend? [Reveals paper ticket]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh honey you didn't buy a ticket?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I did!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh honey. I'm not home, very often. And uh, me and my relatives, they take up the guesthouse. I think you should check with my office, before you book any dates, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what, in the spirit of full disclosure, I have actually reserved a bunch of different seats on a bunch of different flights, but there are a couple of flights that only have two tickets left, so I think we should pull the trigger and -

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Enough!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, everybody, just try to put a brave face on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let's follow the chain of events. Jo likes Michael. Jo invites Michael to house. Jo doesn't like Michael anymore. Hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: [singing] Moving on up, to the East Side, to the deluxe apartment in the sky...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello. I want you to stop what you're doing right now. You are stressed, and I'm taking you to lunch.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: No, that's very generous of you, but I'm all set.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No is not an option.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Well if you need me, I'll be on the other side of that wall. Knock once for yes, twice for no.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: How many knocks does it take to get you to do some work?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] I'll be over there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And I'm actually pleased to be able to offer you printer cartridges and toner now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Whispers] Oh Jim, Jim! Sorry to bother you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My headphones are broken.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can I listen to my music at a low volume?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah that's great. Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay? [Unplugs cord, sings] "The cat's in the cradle and the silver spoon, little boy blue-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Overlapping] When's the last time you upgraded your printer?

quotes.speaker: D
quotes.line: "- and the man in the moon. When you coming home Dad? I don't know when-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Whispers] Please stop that!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: "-But we'll be together then-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Can you grow up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: "-Dad, you know we'll have a good time then."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Turns off Dwight's music] Whether it's this time or next time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Vocalizes and continues song] "The cat's in the cradle and the silver spoon"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [On business call] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Dwight
quotes.line: [Singing, Dwight supplies beats] "Little boy blue and the man in the moon."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, we definitely can talk about it in the next--

quotes.speaker: Andy and Dwight
quotes.line: "When you coming home Dad?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know, can I call you back?

quotes.speaker: Andy and Dwight
quotes.line: "I don't know when-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That would be great, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Dwight
quotes.line: "But we'll get together then, we're gonna have a good time-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [On phone in hallway] No, I know I need to work, I just- I feel weird not being home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am not surprised that Dwight's using my baby to steal my desk. I'm a little surprised that it's working.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: This fax came for you. [Coughs]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh no no no!  Are you feeling ill?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh no honey, if you got a bug, I want you to go on home. I can't have you getting Callie and Jo Jr. sick. These dogs have got to be in a commercial with Dwight Howard next week.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh! No. I feel like I could lift a car.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yeah, but you sound like death, girl. Now why don't you go on home and take care of yourself and get in bed. And shred that and have them send me a clean fax, okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well... [Jo closes door on her]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: She should go home. It's not the end of the world. We'll go on our date next week. She's still gonna like me in a week. Right?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I was just working at my desk and I wanted to run some new leads by you. [Turns feint]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh! You're sick! [Andy coughs] Dangit! That's exactly why I sent that receptionist home.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Get everybody sick in the office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I have some good ideas...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: We don't need any heroes here honey. It's time for you to get on home now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: You'll probably feel better once you get some pants on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Very nice.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Not bad, huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A real Hoop Dreams story you got there. Oh man, you seem to have caught Jo's eye. How'd you make that happen?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: I impressed her with my good ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hm mm. Seriously, how did you do it?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: I made a suggestion at the meeting that was good. You were there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How do I put this delicately? Does her family owe your family something, in terms of a past injustice?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Now Mike, I have to ask you to leave, so that I can learn about this tiny television.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. All right.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Hey there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey there. So I think I'm done. Gonna head out. Unless you want to chat. Like we were doing earlier.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well there's chatting time and there's working time. I'm still on working time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm? Well, the clock says chatting time, so.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well, if you feel like you've done a solid days work...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Right. What?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well I mean, if you can put your name on this day, and be proud of the amount of work you've done, then, by all means, you should toodle on home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm. mm. Oh well.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Anything else I can help you with?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. That's super-clear-ish. [Exits, closes door, takes off coat.] Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Just because Jo has no life, does not mean that the rest of us don't have lives. Oscar has a life. I think Ryan has a life. This is outrageous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Pack-man.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey what's up, Butt-plug?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How you doing stud? You already there?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Dude, I've been here since three! I've boot and rallied twice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How's the lady situation?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Fat and ugly. You might actually have a chance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah damn. That sounds great. Unfortunately I am stuck here, because my boss is making us work late.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Oh here's what you do. Hike up your skirt and pull out your tampon, borrow some balls and come meet me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Maybe next year.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Maybe next "queer." Hey ladies, who wants some bangers and mash?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [Opens door, surprised] Oh! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I'm in my jammy-jams!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's okay, I'm in my "worky-works." You look amazing!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, thanks. Come in!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey! Me and Creed are in. Are you guys in?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: All right. [The four of them get out of chairs to run out, Jo exits her office. They retreat.]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh, you don't become the most powerful woman in Tallahassee by slacking off. [Scoffs] You do it by working hard. Or marrying rich. I did both!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah. Got a little client meeting at Shanny O'Gannigan's tonight. It shouldn't go all night long, so if you'd like me to, I could swing by your house so the baby can experience a strong male presence. [Jim is silent] No? Nothing? Okay. Have fun working. [Whistles "Cat's in the Cradle" song]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hi there Jo. Sorry to interrupt. Um, this evening [phone rings] I have...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey Jo, it's Jim Halpert. I actually scheduled a meeting at 7:30 with a very important client. And it's so weird, because we never have meetings after 5pm. But I was hoping that maybe just this once, it would be okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well sure. You know, you go ahead and push some printers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know I will. And by the way, seriously, we never, never do this!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Sorry Sugar. What'd you want?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, you see, I actually do have a meeting. With a client. I'm just gonna reschedule for next week.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [pops back into Jo's doorway] Thanks again by the way.

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Hey! What are you fellas doing up here?

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guy 1
quotes.line: We're here to bust you out!

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: I wish, but uh-

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guy 1
quotes.line: Dude! Your shirt tucked in?

quotes.speaker: Daryl
quotes.line: Oh. Yeah, um, I must have did that when I was in the bathroom.  All right then, uh, let me get to it.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guy 1
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guy 2
quotes.line: See you later.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Your hand's cold.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It is? I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah, have some more blanket.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Reid
quotes.line: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You're awake. Andy, this is my brother, Reid.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I didn't know you had a brother.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: He's my foster brother.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, any brother of Erin's is a friend of mine. Nice to meet you. Andy Bernard. [They shake hands]

quotes.speaker: Reid
quotes.line: Cold hands. [Takes spot next to Erin on love seat]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are we rotating seats, or?

quotes.speaker: Reid
quotes.line: Oh yeah, you're the guest. Take the easy chair, best seat in the house. Plus, you don't have to sit next to this big dork and her smelly feet.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey! My feet aren't smelly, they smell like roses. Smell them! [puts her feet in his face]

quotes.speaker: Reid
quotes.line: Ooh! [Erin giggles]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So, how does the whole foster sibling thing work? Do you guys share one parent or-?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: None. We were in the same house from ages ten to twelve. And then from fifteen to eighteen.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: All right. Formative years. [She laughs]

quotes.speaker: Reid
quotes.line: Nice skirt.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, it's a kilt.

quotes.speaker: Night cleaning crew
quotes.line: Oh! Sorry! Sorry, sorry. [They retreat. Pan around office still full with staff.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes, I'm anxious to get off work. But let me be clear. It's not to celebrate St Patrick's Day. It's so I can protest St. Patrick's Day.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Overnight all my damn bags home. I'm carrying nothing but my Sable gloves.  I've had it with Homeland Security. And I want you to put all those tracking numbers in my Blackberry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How late do we have to work tonight?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: You never know with Jo. Sometimes we're here til midnight. Sometimes she doesn't show up for three days.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why does she do that? Why doesn't she just tell you what your schedule is?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Yeah, that would be awesome. I could get a girlfriend. Wouldn't have to go to Amsterdam seven times a year. But uh, I'm young, right?  I will date when I'm dead! [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do I really want to turn out like Gabe? Twenty-six. Single. Tied to my desk. No life, no family. I want to have been married by the time I would've turned thirty. That's just - that's just depressing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello Jo.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Anything I can do for you Puddin'?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There is, as a matter of fact. It's getting sorta late. It's 8:30. And it's St. Patrick's Day, which is a world ethnic holiday. So I have decided I'm going to dismiss my employees.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm thrilled with the work they've done today, both quality and the quantity. Great performance, Very, very solid all the way around.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: All right then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Happy St. Patrick's Day. [Starts to leave office] And also, I would like to say that I will be canceling my trip down to Tallahassee. Although I do look forward to our professional relationship.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: I look forward to that too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ooh. It's coming down out there.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes. Thank you, for coming all the way here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, I-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I'm so sorry I was so sick. [Andy leans in. She leans in. Reid appears in background. Erin kisses Andy on the cheek.]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ah. Oh great, now I'm gonna get sick. [They both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Excuse me, excuse me. Hey guys!

quotes.speaker: Meredith, Creed, Oscar and Matt
quotes.line: [cheering Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Drinks are on me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No! No, no no! Put your credit cards away. Drinks are on us!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh -hoh! All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Did I mess up my career today? My future prospects at Sabre? I don't know. There is a chance. Yes. I tell you I love my job. But Jo wants me to put on a show for her, and pretend to work late?  Nah. I spent all day, trying to make her like me, and I forgot to ask myself something: Do I even like her?  As the Irish poet Bobby McFerrin says, "Don't worry, be happy."

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Whoops! [Humps Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Okay, all right. Best night ever. [Meredith joins behind Packer] What the hell is going on back there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. We should be able to have that right over to you by Monday. Yeah no problem. [Reveal Jim behind Quad-Desk] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What the hell is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is not Mega-Desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, it's not. They call it Quad-Desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's ridiculous, this is made up of three desks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God. We're going to have to re-name it then aren't we? [Dwight's phone rings. He crawls into nook under Jim's Quad-Desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello, Dwight Schrute?
